info.title: Slack Web API
info.description: One way to interact with the Slack platform is its HTTP RPC-based Web API, a collection of methods requiring OAuth 2.0-based user, bot, or workspace tokens blessed with related OAuth scopes.

externalDocs.description: Learn more about the Slack Web API

post.description: Registers a new Call.

external_unique_id.description: An ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. It must be unique across all Calls from that service.

external_display_id.description: An optional, human-readable ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. If supplied, this ID will be displayed in the Call object.

join_url.description: The URL required for a client to join the Call.

desktop_app_join_url.description: When supplied, available Slack clients will attempt to directly launch the 3rd-party Call with this URL.

date_start.description: Call start time in UTC UNIX timestamp format

created_by.description: The valid Slack user ID of the user who created this Call. When this method is called with a user token, the `created_by` field is optional and defaults to the authed user of the token. Otherwise, the field is required.

users.description: The list of users to register as participants in the Call. [Read more on how to specify users here](/apis/calls#users).

external_unique_id.description: An ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. It must be unique across all Calls from that service.

external_display_id.description: An optional, human-readable ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. If supplied, this ID will be displayed in the Call object.

join_url.description: The URL required for a client to join the Call.

desktop_app_join_url.description: When supplied, available Slack clients will attempt to directly launch the 3rd-party Call with this URL.

date_start.description: Call start time in UTC UNIX timestamp format

created_by.description: The valid Slack user ID of the user who created this Call. When this method is called with a user token, the `created_by` field is optional and defaults to the authed user of the token. Otherwise, the field is required.

users.description: The list of users to register as participants in the Call. [Read more on how to specify users here](/apis/calls#users).

post.description: Deletes a message.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

as_user.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

as_user.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

post.description: Deletes a pending scheduled message from the queue.

as_user.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

channel.description: The channel the scheduled_message is posting to

as_user.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

channel.description: The channel the scheduled_message is posting to

post.description: Share a me message into a channel.

channel.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

text.description: Text of the message to send.

channel.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

text.description: Text of the message to send.

post.description: Sends an ephemeral message to a user in a channel.

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user. Defaults to true if the chat:write:bot scope is not included. Otherwise, defaults to false.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides `icon_url`. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to `false`, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

text.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to post this message in a thread. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent's value instead. Ephemeral messages in threads are only shown if there is already an active thread.

user.description: `id` of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. The user should be in the channel specified by the `channel` argument.

username.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

post.description: Post messages to public channels, private channels, direct messages, and multi-person direct messages.

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides `icon_url`. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to `false`, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

mrkdwn.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to `false`. Enabled by default.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

text.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

username.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides `icon_url`. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to `false`, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

mrkdwn.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to `false`. Enabled by default.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

text.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

username.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

text.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

post_at.description: Unix EPOCH timestamp of time in future to send the message.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#formatting).

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#authorship).

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or DM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

text.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. [See below](#text_usage) for more detail.

post_at.description: Unix EPOCH timestamp of time in future to send the message.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#formatting).

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [chat.postMessage](chat.postMessage#authorship).

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

schema.description: Schema for successful response of chat.scheduleMessage method

message.text: Here's a message for you in the future

schema.description: Schema for error response chat.scheduleMessage method

get.description: Returns a list of scheduled messages.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The channel of the scheduled messages

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: A UNIX timestamp of the latest value in the time range

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: A UNIX timestamp of the oldest value in the time range

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of original entries to return.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: For pagination purposes, this is the `cursor` value returned from a previous call to `chat.scheduledmessages.list` indicating where you want to start this call from.

schema.title: chat.scheduledMessages.list schema
schema.description: Schema for successful response from chat.scheduledMessages.list method

scheduled_messages.text: Here's a message for you in the future

default.description: Typical error response if the channel passed is invalid

schema.title: chat.scheduledMessages.list error schema
schema.description: Schema for error response from chat.scheduledMessages.list method

post.description: Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs

channel.description: Channel ID of the message

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

unfurls.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the the message, pointing to their unfurl blocks or message attachments.

user_auth_message.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

user_auth_required.description: Set to `true` or `1` to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain

user_auth_url.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

channel.description: Channel ID of the message

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

unfurls.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the the message, pointing to their unfurl blocks or message attachments.

user_auth_message.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

user_auth_required.description: Set to `true` or `1` to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain

user_auth_url.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

schema.title: chat.unfurl success schema
schema.description: Schema for successful response from chat.unfurl method

schema.title: chat.unfurl error schema
schema.description: Schema for error response from chat.unfurl method

post.description: Updates a message.

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string. This field is required when not presenting `text`. If you don't include this field, the message's previous `attachments` will be retained. To remove previous `attachments`, include an empty array for this field.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of [structured blocks](/block-kit/building), presented as a URL-encoded string. If you don't include this field, the message's previous `blocks` will be retained. To remove previous `blocks`, include an empty array for this field.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to `none`. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, `none`.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `client`, unlike `chat.postMessage`. Accepts either `none` or `full`. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, `client`.

text.description: New text for the message, using the [default formatting rules](/reference/surfaces/formatting). It's not required when presenting `blocks` or `attachments`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string. This field is required when not presenting `text`. If you don't include this field, the message's previous `attachments` will be retained. To remove previous `attachments`, include an empty array for this field.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of [structured blocks](/block-kit/building), presented as a URL-encoded string. If you don't include this field, the message's previous `blocks` will be retained. To remove previous `blocks`, include an empty array for this field.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to `none`. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, `none`.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `client`, unlike `chat.postMessage`. Accepts either `none` or `full`. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, `client`.

text.description: New text for the message, using the [default formatting rules](/reference/surfaces/formatting). It's not required when presenting `blocks` or `attachments`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

get.description: Fetches a conversation's history of messages and events.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Conversation ID to fetch history for.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.

parameters.name: oldest
parameters.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results.

parameters.name: inclusive
parameters.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the `cursor` parameter to a `next_cursor` attribute returned by a previous request's `response_metadata`. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection. See [pagination](/docs/pagination) for more detail.

200.description: Typical success response containing a channel's messages

schema.title: conversations.history success schema
schema.description: Schema for successful response from conversations.history method

messages.text: I find you punny and would like to smell your nose letter
What, you want to smell my shoes better?

schema.title: conversations.history error schema
schema.description: Schema for error response from conversations.history method

get.description: Retrieve information about a conversation.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Conversation ID to learn more about

parameters.name: include_locale
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to receive the locale for this conversation. Defaults to `false`

parameters.name: include_num_members
parameters.description: Set to `true` to include the member count for the specified conversation. Defaults to `false`

get.description: Lists all channels in a Slack team.

parameters.name: exclude_archived
parameters.description: Set to `true` to exclude archived channels from the list

parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Include labels for each ID in custom profile fields

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User to retrieve profile info for

schema.title: users.profile.get schema
schema.description: Schema for successful response from users.profile.get method

schema.title: users.profile.get error schema
schema.description: Schema for error response from users.profile.get method

post.description: Set the profile information for a user.

name.description: Name of a single key to set. Usable only if `profile` is not passed.

profile.description: Collection of key:value pairs presented as a URL-encoded JSON hash. At most 50 fields may be set. Each field name is limited to 255 characters.

user.description: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by team admins on paid teams.

value.description: Value to set a single key to. Usable only if `profile` is not passed.

name.description: Name of a single key to set. Usable only if `profile` is not passed.

profile.description: Collection of key:value pairs presented as a URL-encoded JSON hash. At most 50 fields may be set. Each field name is limited to 255 characters.

value.description: Value to set a single key to. Usable only if `profile` is not passed.

get.description: Open a view for a user.

parameters.name: trigger_id
parameters.description: Exchange a trigger to post to the user.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: A [view payload](/reference/surfaces/views). This must be a JSON-encoded string.

200.description: Typical success response includes the opened view payload.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

default.description: Typical error response, before getting to any possible validation errors.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Publish a static view for a User.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: `id` of the user you want publish a view to.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: A [view payload](/reference/surfaces/views). This must be a JSON-encoded string.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: A string that represents view state to protect against possible race conditions.

200.description: Typical success response includes the published view payload.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

text.text: A simple section with some sample sentence.

default.description: Typical error response, before getting to any possible validation errors.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Push a view onto the stack of a root view.

parameters.name: trigger_id
parameters.description: Exchange a trigger to post to the user.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: A [view payload](/reference/surfaces/views). This must be a JSON-encoded string.

200.description: Typical success response includes the pushed view payload.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Update an existing view.

parameters.name: view_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the view to be updated. Either `view_id` or `external_id` is required.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the view set by the developer. Must be unique for all views on a team. Max length of 255 characters. Either `view_id` or `external_id` is required.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: A [view object](/reference/surfaces/views). This must be a JSON-encoded string.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: A string that represents view state to protect against possible race conditions.

200.description: Typical success response includes the updated view payload.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

text.text: I am but an updated modal

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Indicate that an app's step in a workflow completed execution.

parameters.name: workflow_step_execute_id
parameters.description: Context identifier that maps to the correct workflow step execution.

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: Key-value object of outputs from your step. Keys of this object reflect the configured `key` properties of your [`outputs`](/reference/workflows/workflow_step#output) array from your `workflow_step` object.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Indicate that an app's step in a workflow failed to execute.

parameters.name: workflow_step_execute_id
parameters.description: Context identifier that maps to the correct workflow step execution.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A JSON-based object with a `message` property that should contain a human readable error message.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

get.description: Update the configuration for a workflow extension step.

parameters.name: workflow_step_edit_id
parameters.description: A context identifier provided with `view_submission` payloads used to call back to `workflows.updateStep`.

parameters.name: inputs
parameters.description: A JSON key-value map of inputs required from a user during configuration. This is the data your app expects to receive when the workflow step starts. **Please note**: the embedded variable format is set and replaced by the workflow system. You cannot create custom variables that will be replaced at runtime. [Read more about variables in workflow steps here](/workflows/steps#variables).

parameters.name: outputs
parameters.description: An JSON array of output objects used during step execution. This is the data your app agrees to provide when your workflow step was executed.

parameters.name: step_name
parameters.description: An optional field that can be used to override the step name that is shown in the Workflow Builder.

parameters.name: step_image_url
parameters.description: An optional field that can be used to override app image that is shown in the Workflow Builder.

schema.title: Default success template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.

schema.title: Default error template
schema.description: This method either only returns a brief _not OK_ response or a verbose schema is not available for this method.
